definition[0]: used when you are adding something, especially something surprising, to emphasize what you have just said
example[0]: I know the mayor really well. In fact, I had dinner with her last week.
definition[1]: used to emphasize that the truth about a situation is the opposite of what has been mentioned
example[1]: They told me it would be cheap but in fact it cost me nearly $500.
example[2]: Her teachers said she was a slow learner, whereas in actual fact she was partially deaf.
